6.heading: Roubicek, Dorothy.
6.title: All Star Comics Archives. v. 4
6.author: foreword by James Robinson.
notes: Collects the Justice Society stories from All Star Comics #15-18 (1943).

Stories in this collection are written by Gardner Fox and Sheldon Mayer, and drawn by Joe Gallagher, Sheldon Moldoff, Stan Asch, Joe Simon, Jack Kirby, Ed Dobrotka, Bernard Baily, Howard Sherman, Paul Reinman, Pierce Rice, and Arthur Cazeneuve, with covers by Frank Harry. Editors are Sheldon Mayer and Dorothy Roubicek. Brief biographies are presented at the end of the volume.

7.heading: Roubicek, Dorothy.
7.title: All Star Comics Archives. v. 5
7.author: foreword by R
notes: Collects the Justice Society and Hop Harrigan stories from All Star Comics, no. 19-23 (1943-1944).

Stories in the collection are written by Gardner Fox and Sheldon Mayer, and drawn by Joe Gallagher, Stan Aschmeier, Joe Simon, Jack Kirby, Bernard Baily, Sheldon Moldoff, and Joe Kubert, with one cover by Frank Harry. Editors are Sheldon Mayer and Dorothy Roubicek. Brief biographies are presented at the end of the volume.

Panel and caption style, from Le Rire between 1890 and 1910.

24.heading: Rouge, Michel, 1950-
24.title: Les Chatiments de la Mer Morte
24.author: Fred Le Berre, Michel Rouge.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Le juge Shimon de Samarie est samaritain de naissance, mais a été éduqué à Rome. Il est considéré comme juif par les Romains et comme Romain par sa famille, ce qui ne l'aide pas dans son métier. Un séisme secoue le Temple et un homme est retrouvé mort à l'intérieur d'un bâtiment. Pourtant, il n'a pas été victime du tremblement de terre. Shimon enquête sur ce meurtre et découvre des secrets qui bouleversent son entourage. Cette enquête en deux parties reconstitue l'atmosphère de cette époque de la Palestine. Le scénario est bien ficelé et le graphisme au trait léger arbore des couleurs chaudes.
Detective and historical genres, set in Roman-occupied Palestine.

57.heading: Rouger, Jean-Jacques.
57.title: La Marie en Plastique :
57.author: un récit de Pascal Rabaté ; avec David Prudhomme au dessin ; et de chouettes couleurs d'Isabelle Merlet, Jean-Jacques Rouger et David Prudhomme.
notes: Summary (from publisher via OCLC): Une famille française ordinaire où le rôle de chacun est bien distribué, les conflits bien rodés, où tout le monde est bien à l'abri d'une quelconque surprise. Et voilà qu'une niaise bondieuserie en plastique jette le trouble dans ce tranquille foyer et fait virer tout cela à l'aigre. Doux Jésus, Sainte Vierge! On est vraiment bien peu de chose.

79.title: Rough Diamond.
79.author: [No author]
notes: "When young Bobbie's parents split and her mother moves from their farm in the country to the big city, Bobbie has no choice, she has to go with her mother! Too bad Bobbie hates the city. No friends, no family except an overworked mother, and no horses! But then she meets Melanie, who needs a friend more than Bobbie does, and a strange girl named Angelica with mysterious powers, who leads her to a horse in even greater need!"

103.heading: Rough Riders.
103.title: "The Hero of San Juan Hill!" 6 p. in Star Spangled War Stories, no. 12
103.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: "Bad enough to be a bashful youngster with gallant dreams that make grown men laugh, but if you're also named Wilfred, and you aim to campaign in Cuba with Teddy Roosevelt's daredevil rough riders, Arizona Toohey, Dynamite Morgan, and the rest, you've got a real problem. Here's how young Wilfred Clay solves that problem the hard way."

104.heading: Rough Riders.
104.title: "The Return of Morgan the Raider" 10 p. in Top Secrets, no. 9
104.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: "Few fighters of the American Civil War were more daring than the Confederate general John H. Morgan, whose mounted riflemen, a division of 2500 men, were the first to be termed 'rough riders.' Yet Morgan, by that very daring was captured by the Union forces at the time he was most needed. How he escaped and returned to his command was the 'top secret' of its time."

112.author: [No author]

contents.title: "Dut par Manuel Hirtz et Harry Morgan"

notes: English summary (from p. 151): "Rough Sketches and Crayon Drawings: Lessons in Method. '9e Art' has taken six pencilled drawings from the museum collections. These are by Pinchon, Hergé, Dut, Tardi, Kurtzman and Baudoin. Using these previously unpublished documents in which the act of creation can be seized in its very intimacy, the editorial staff investigates the purpose of rough sketches in the genesis of a comic and underlines the diversity of practises."

152.heading: Rouillon, Perrine--Miscellanea.
152.title: "Du Minimalisme dans la Bande Dessinée"
152.author: Thierry Groensteen
152.appears_in: p. 84-93 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 6 (Jan. 2001).
notes: Begins: "Si le minimalisme est une tendance de la bande dessinée contemporaine, elle ne concerne que peu d'artistes et il n'est certes pas dans sa nature de prétendre à un grand développement ni à une large popularité. Incarnée aujourd'hui par des dessinateurs tels que les Français Lewis Trondheim et Perrine Rouillon, les Espagnols Calpurnio et Silvestre ou encore la Néerlandaise Maaîke Hartjes, ce n'est pourtant pas une tendence tout à fait nouvelle, ses racines remontant, autant que nous sachions, aux années soixante."

English summary (from p. 151): "On Minimalism in Comics. Minimalism is defined as an art of very little and, often, miniaturism is a tendency of artists such as Trondheim, Calpurnio or Maaike Hartjes. Thierry Groensteen explores its genealogy and finds its roots in certain strips from the sixties, those of Theo by Ralph Steadman, for example."

156.heading: Rouleau, Duncan.
156.title: Metal Men
156.author: writer & artist, Duncan Rouleau ; colorists, Moose Baumann, Pete Pantazis ; letterer, Pat Brosseau.
notes: Story based on ideas by Grant Morrison.
"Originally published in single magazine form in Metal Men 1-8."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Gold, Platina, Mercury, Iron, Lead, Tin and Copper are the amazing androids who combine their unique abilities and clashing personalities to fight for justice under the watchful eye of their creator, Doc Magnus. But within the "responsometers" that give them life lies an ancient weapon that can control the very fabric of the world. To keep their scientific secret, Magnus and his Metal Men must mine a mother lode of villains.

200.heading: Round, Julia.
200.title: Gothic in Comics and Graphic Novels : a Critical Approach
200.author: Julia Round.
notes: "This book explores the connections between comics and the Gothic from four different angles: historical, formal, cultural and textual. It identifies structures, styles and themes drawn from literary Gothic traditions and discusses their presence in British and American comics today, with particular attention to the DC Vertigo imprint."
